sentences.sContent: Torrential rain drove the players off the course.
sentences.sCn: 滂沱大雨迫使选手们离开了赛场。

sentences.sContent: With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
sentences.sCn: 随着几声响亮的哨声，他们把驴子赶出了围栏。

sentences.sContent: ...So it might be a good idea to get someone else to drive you home after that marathon...
...Maria and her daughter drive an ice-cream truck through neighborhoods and parks in Billings...
...I always make sure the third one gets something because I can't drive away and have that third one not have something...
...But because you can't drive a car and watch television at the same time...
...The movies were widely predicted to drive live theater out of the marketplace...
...Sometimes a new technology doesn't drive the old one out...
...I don't like to let anyone else drive my car...
...But she does have to drive through very heavy traffic to get here...

synos.tran: 推动，发动（机器等）；[交]驾驶（马车，汽车等）；驱赶
[机]驱动器；驾车；[动][心理]内驱力，推进力；快车道

phrases.pCn: 主传动；主驱动装置；肢动装置
可以开上去的；继续开车
抬高；开车赶到；迫使…上升
电力传动；电力驱动装置
驱动控制（等于horizontal drive control）

words.tran: 强劲的；推进的；精力旺盛的
驾驶员；驱动程序；起子；传动器
畜群；牛群、羊群等；移动的人群或大批的东西
把家畜赶到市集的人；家畜商人；牲畜贩子

trans.tranOther: to force a person or animal to go somewhere
